raw_text:
Slovakia reach Hopman Cup final
 
 Slovakia will play Argentina in the final of the Hopman Cup after beating Group B rivals the Netherlands 3-0.
 
 Daniela Hantuchova defeated Michaella Krajicek 6-4 6-2 to give the Slovaks the perfect start before Dutchman Peter Wessels retired against Dominik Hrbaty. Wessels was unable to compete in the mixed doubles but Slovakia had already booked their place in the final for the second year running. Argentina claimed top spot in Group A with three wins from three matches. In the other Group B match, the United States defeated Australia 2-1.
 
 Meghann Shaughnessy lost the opening match against Alicia Molik but James Blake levelled the tie with a 6-3 6-4 win over Paul Baccanello, who came in as a replacement for the injured Mark Philippoussis. Blake and Shaughnessy then beat Molik and Baccanello in a tense mixed doubles contest to take the win. Hantuchova, who did not win a Hopman Cup singles match in 2004, has been in good form during this year's event and has won two of her three matches. "I feel like it's really deserved this time as I've helped Dominik to get through," she said. "I think if I keep going the way I have been in the past few matches then I will be okay. "I was really pleased with my last two singles, even the first one, which was a really high standard. "You can't ask for a better preparation than to play a few matches here for the Australian Open."
llama3.2:1b: Slovakia plays Argentina in Hopman Cup final after beating Netherlands 3-0 and winning Group B with three wins from three matches.
Daniela Hantuchova defeated Dominik Hrbaty, Peter Wessels retired, and Meghann Shaughnessy lost to Alicia Molik in the first match of her career.
llama3.2:3b: Slovakia beat Netherlands 3-0 in Hopman Cup Group B to reach the final against Argentina.
Daniela Hantuchova defeated Michaella Krajicek, and Dominik Hrbaty partnered Peter Wessels before Wessels retired.
Slovakia will face Argentina for the second year in a row.
gemma2:2b: Slovakia defeated the Netherlands 3-0 in the Hopman Cup Group B and will face Argentina in the final.
The Slovaks advanced to the finals after Daniela Hantuchova won her singles match against Michaella Krajicek, followed by Peter Wessels' retirement due to injury.
Argentina topped Group A with three wins in three matches.
In a tense tie, James Blake helped the United States beat Australia 2-1 despite Meghann Shaughnessy losing the opening singles match.
The US duo then won the mixed doubles against Molik and Baccanello, securing their victory.
Hantuchova's strong performance has been crucial for Slovakia, who are looking forward to the Australian Open.

Meghann Shaughnessy lost the opening match and James Blake won a mixed doubles contest to level the tie, though Hantuchova was not in good form but has been improving.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Slovakia overcomes Netherlands 3-0 in Hopman Cup Group B final and advances to meet Argentina.
Hantuchova leads Slovakia's unbeaten campaign, while Blake beats Molik and Baccanello in mixed doubles to secure victory.
qwen2.5:3b: Slovakia reached the Hopman Cup final by defeating Netherlands 3-0 in the group stage.
Daniela Hantuchova won her singles match against Michaella Krajicek, while Peter Wessels retired due to injury.
Slovakia also had Dominik Hrbaty for mixed doubles.
Argentina topped Group A with three wins and defeated Australia 2-1 in another group match.
The United States beat Australia 2-1, securing a spot in the final as well.
Meghann Shaughnessy won her singles against Alicia Molik but lost to Paul Baccanello initially.
James Blake and Shaughnessy secured the win in mixed doubles.
Hantuchova expressed satisfaction with her recent form leading up to the tournament.
opencoder:1.5b: Slovakia and Argentina will play in the Hopman Cup final.
Argentina defeated Michaella Krajicek 6-4 6-2 to start Slovakia.
After that, Wessels, which was unable to compete, booked their place in the final for the second year running.
Slovakia had already won two Group A matches and the United States also defeated Australia by a win.

Daniela Hantuchova has been in good form during this year's event and won two of her three matches, making her feel happy that she can continue to play with her replacements Mark Philippoussis and James Blake.
The event shows how hard it is to keep up after the loss.
Shaughnessy lost against Alicia Molik but they beat Baccanello, who came in as a replacement for the injured Mark Philippoussis.
They then beat both of them in a mixed doubles contest which proved that even if you don't win a match, you can still keep up.
Hantuchova says she feels alright and continues to play as it is challenging to stay healthy after losing hard times like this.

deepseek-r1:1.5b: Slovakia reached the Hopman Cup final after defeating Group B rivals Netherlands 3-0.
Daniela Hantuchova secured a strong start, defeating Michaella Krajicek 6-4 6-2, giving them their perfect start.
Peter Wessels retired against Dominik Hrbaty, and Slovakia was placed in the final for the second year running with Peter's retirement adding significance to the match.
Argentina claimed top spot in Group A with three wins from three matches.
In another match, Meghann Shaughnessy lost to Alicia Molik but James Blake levelled with Paul Baccanello, who replaced injured Mark Philippoussis.
They secured the win in a tense mixed doubles contest, taking home the victory.
Hantuchova, who did not win singles last year, has been in good form this year and has won two matches.
She expressed her determination to do well at the Hopman Cup and noted playing the Australian Open as preparation for the tournament.
tinyllama:1.1b: Slovakia secured their place in the final of the Hopman Cup after defeating the Netherlands by a clean sweep in three matches.
Top seed Slovakians started strongly, winning the first two matches against Group B rivals Netherlands with comfortable margins.
In the other match, the United States also recorded straight-set wins to claim top spot in the group and advance to face Argentina in the final on Tuesday.

Meghan Shaughnessy was a late withdrawal from the mixed doubles event due to injury, but James Blake partnered with Alicia Molik to secure a 6-3, 6-4 victory over Mark Philippoussis's replacement partner Paul Baccanello in the final mixed doubles match.
Slovakia won two out of three matches, and Han Tuutschova was victorious in her singles match despite losing the first set to Dominik Hrbek.
However, she bounced back with a 6-4, 6-2 win in the second set and then defeated Michael Krajicek in the final mixed doubles.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Slovakia has secured their place in the final of the Hopman Cup after defeating Netherlands in a hard-fought match, 3-0.
Daniela Hantuchova and Michaella Krajicek were victorious in their mixed doubles against Peter Wessels and Dominik Hrbaty.
In Group B, Argentina secured top spot with three wins from three matches.
Slovakia took the lead against Australia, while the United States defeated Australia, 2-1.
Molik led Shaughnessy to victory with a 6-3 6-4 win against Alicia Molik.
James Blake and Meghann Shaughnessy also secured their victories with a strong 6-3 6-4 match against Paul Baccanello.
Hantuchova, who has been in good form this year, did not win her singles match but still helped Dominik to get through his match.
The Czech player was pleased with the way she had been playing recently and stated that if she keeps going the way she has been, she will be fine.
She mentioned her last two singles matches were particularly high-quality and wished to continue with that level of play for the Australian Open.
